intro: Goniolimon dshungaricum, commonly known as the Siberian sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh climates. Goniolimon dshungaricum is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
